page.title: 05Framlingham,Sir Rbt.Hitcham.
page.content: Sir Robert Hitcham was a 17th century lawyer who bought the castle and its estates. A bachelor,he left much of his money in trust to be spent building 12 almshouses for old people and a school for poor children. Eight people remain as trustees, four from the Town Council and four from Pembroke College, where Sir Robert was a student. The money is invested and Mr. Baker,Treasurer of the Trust and Mrs. Ward, the Clerk keep the accounts. The almshouses have recently had the central heating modernised. It costs about $10,000 a year to run the almshouses including free heating, lighting, repairs, insurance and the wages for a warden. One or two persons can rent an almshouse for $9.30 a week. The school we attend is named after Sir Robert; we still receive extra money from the trust. Sir Robert's tomb can be seen in the chancel of the church.
